My apologies, this build happened while Qt-5.9 was temporariy a buildroot override (poppler-qt5 currently has unsatisfied dependency on Qt-5.9).  2 options: rebuild again or wait for Qt-5.9.x to land in updates (If it were me, I'd do the former, so this could go stable faster)

Same issue here, installing this package from updates-testing using dnf is not possible as it wants to uninstall poppler-qt5. New bug report for that issue: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1502335

The requisite qt5-qtbase package is available in a separate update,
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-c133443edc

Works fine for me too, now, after the qt packages have been updated.

@hreindl: If the package does not install from updates-testing, it is broken. That's not about being uneducated or not.

bugs.title: CVE-2017-14517 poppler: NULL pointer dereference in the XRef::parseEntry() function

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-14517 poppler: NULL pointer dereference in the XRef::parseEntry() function

long_desc.thetext:
A NULL Pointer Dereference was found in poppler in the XRef::parseEntry() function in XRef.cc. A local attacker could use a maliciously crafted PDF document to crash the application.

Upstream issue:

https://bugs.freedesktop.org/show_bug.cgi?id=102687

Created mingw-poppler tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1499169]


Created poppler tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1499168]

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1499905,1499906

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======
